intro: Chrysocephalum semipapposum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved everlasting, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces yellow to golden-orange flowers that bloom in summer. It is often found in sandy or rocky soils and is well adapted to arid environments. The plant is valued for its ornamental appeal and is used in gardens and floral arrangements.
